title: Assignment Operator
explanation: `<-` is the standard assignment operator. `=` is allowed but `<-` is preferred. `-<` is a syntax error (likely typo for `<-`).

title: Vector Creation
explanation: True. `c()` creates a vector.

title: Vector Indexing
explanation: R uses 1-based indexing. `v[0]` returns `numeric(0)` (empty vector) or type-specific empty, capturing 'nothing', but usually the user intends `v[1]`. While not a runtime 'error' (crash), it is a logical error for accessing the first element.

title: Comment Syntax
explanation: True. `#` starts a comment.

title: For Loop Syntax
explanation: Missing parentheses around loop variable/range. format: `for (i in 1:5) { ... }`.

title: Range Operator
explanation: True. Creates sequence 1 to 10.

title: Function Definition
explanation:
Valid. 
Error: `def` keyword? 
Code: `def my_fun(x) {}`. 
Error: R uses `function()`, not `def`. 
Correct snippet:

title: Def Keyword
explanation: R uses `function` keyword to define functions, not `def`.

title: Implicit Return
explanation: True. Last expression is returned implicitly.

title: If Statement Brackets
explanation: Condition in `if` must be in parentheses: `if (x > 5)`.

title: Logical AND
explanation: True. `&` is element-wise logical AND.

title: DataFrame Column Access
explanation: Use `$` to access columns by name: `df$a`. `df.a` looks for an object named `df.a` (dot is valid in identifiers), not a property access.

title: Comparison Equality
explanation: True. `==` checks equality.

title: List Creation
explanation: Function is `list()`, lowercase. `List` (capitalized) does not exist in base R.

title: Atomic Vectors
explanation: True. Coerces 1 to "1". Result is character vector.

title: String Concatenation
explanation: `+` is for arithmetic. Use `paste()` or `paste0()` for string concatenation.

title: Missing Value
explanation: True. `NA` represents missing value.

title: Library Load
explanation: R uses `library(dplyr)` or `require(dplyr)`, not `import`.

title: Install Packages
explanation: True. Installs from CRAN.

title: Not Equals Operator
explanation: `<>` is not a standard operator. Use `!=` for inequality.

title: Length Function
explanation: True. Returns 3.

title: Matrix Multiplication
codeSnippet:
m1 <- matrix(1, 2, 2)
m2 <- matrix(2, 2, 2)
prod <- m1 * m2
explanation: `*` performs element-wise multiplication. For matrix multiplication, use `%*%`.

title: Numeric vs Integer
explanation: True. `L` suffix creates an integer.

title: Factor creation
explanation:
Assignment to outside levels? Valid in R extends levels. 
Error: `Factor` type name? `val x: Factor`. 
Real Error: `elseif` keyword. 
Code: `if (x) {} elseif (y) {}`. 
Error: R uses `else if` (space separated).

title: Else If Syntax
explanation: R syntax is `else if`, not `elseif`.

title: Typeof
explanation: True. Returns "double" (default for numbers).

title: Column Name Space
explanation: Spaces in variable names in explicit arguments? Left side of `=` must be valid identifier or quoted. `col name` has space. Should be `"col name" = ...` or `col_name`.

title: Is NA
explanation: True. Correct way to check for NA.

title: Return without parentheses
explanation: `return` is a function call in R. Must use parentheses: `return(x)`.

title: Null Check
explanation: True.

title: Brackets for List
explanation:
Both are valid but different. `[[` extracts element, `[` returns sublist. 
Error: `print x`. 
Code: `print x`. 
Error: `print` requires parentheses.

title: Print Parentheses
explanation: `print` is a function. Must use `print(x)`.

title: Head Function
explanation: True. Shows first rows.

title: Increment Operator
explanation: R does not have `++` operator. Use `x <- x + 1`.

title: Sequence Generation
explanation: True. Returns 0, 2, 4, 6, 8, 10.

title: Length property
explanation: Vectors do not have properties accessed via dot like `v.length`. Use function `length(v)`.

title: Replicate
explanation: True. Repeats 1 five times.

title: Undefined Object
explanation: Object `x` not found (after removal).

title: Logical OR
explanation: True. Returns TRUE.

title: Block without braces
explanation: Without braces `{ }`, `if` only controls the first statement (`x <- 1`). `y <- 2` executes regardless. If intent was block, braces missing.

title: Paste0
explanation: True. Returns "AB".

title: T abbreviation
explanation: `T` and `F` are variables bound to `TRUE` and `FALSE` by default, but can be reassigned. Reassigning them breaks code expecting logicals. Use standard `TRUE` or `FALSE`.

title: Any Function
explanation: True. Returns TRUE.

title: Function arg default syntax
explanation: Default arguments use `=`, not `:`. `function(x = 10)`.

title: Help Operator
explanation: True. Accesses documentation.

title: Double quotes inside double quotes
explanation: Strings delimiters conflict. Escape quotes: `"He said \"Hello\""` or use single quotes `name = '...'`.

title: Names Function
explanation: True. Returns column names.

title: Semi-colon usage
explanation:
Valid. R supports semicolons for multiple statements on one line. 
Error: `...` not passed. 
Code: `f <- function(...) { g() }`. 
Error: `...` argument meant to be passed to internal calls? Valid to ignore. 
Real Error: `break` outside loop. 
Code: `break`.

title: Break context
explanation: `break` is only allowed inside loops (`for`, `while`, `repeat`). usage in `if` is invalid.

title: Matrix dimension
explanation: True. Returns c(2, 3).

title: Index out of bounds
explanation: `v[3]` returns `NA` (valid in R). `v[[3]]` (double bracket) throws error 'subscript out of bounds'.

title: Which Function
explanation: True. Returns indices c(1, 3).

title: Typo in library
explanation: Typo: `library` missing 'r'.

title: Mean Function
explanation: True. Returns 2.

title: Which Max
explanation: Function is `which.max()`, not `max.which()`.

title: All function
explanation: True. Returns TRUE.

title: Sum with NA
explanation:
Valid code, but returns `NA`. Usually user intends `sum(x, na.rm = TRUE)`. Is this an error? If goal is sum. 
Snippet: `print(sum(x))`. Result `NA`. Not a syntax error. 
Let's try: `na.remove` argument? 
Code: `sum(x, na.remove = TRUE)`. 
Error: Argument is `na.rm`.

title: Sum Argument Typo
explanation: Argument is `na.rm`, not `na.remove`.

title: Seq Along
explanation: True. Returns 1:2.

title: Sort vs Order usage
explanation: `sort(df$a)` returns values sorted (1, 2). Using values as indices (`df[1, ]`, `df[2, ]`) coincidentally works here if values match indices, but generally `order()` should be used for sorting data frames by column indices.

title: Round Function
explanation: True. Rounds to nearest even (IEEE 754) or standard depending.

title: Ceil Function
explanation: Function is `ceiling()`, not `ceil` (unless using extra packages).

title: Unique Function
explanation: True. Returns c(1, 2).

title: String Contains
explanation: Strings are not objects with methods in base R. Use `grepl("e", "Hello")`.

title: Grep Function
explanation: True. Returns indices (1, 2).

title: ToUpperCase
explanation: Function is `toupper()`, not `toUpperCase`.

title: Sub Function
explanation: True. Replaces first occurrence: "bonana". (`gsub` for global).

title: Reverse function
explanation: Function is `rev()`, not `reverse`.

title: Lapply Return
explanation: True. `lapply` always returns a list.

title: List element nulling
codeSnippet:
l <- list(a = 1, b = 2)
l$a <- NULL
# list now has length 2?
explanation: Assigning `NULL` to a list element removes it. Length becomes 1. Not a compile error, but tricky logic.

title: Matrix Indexing Comma
explanation:
Valid (matrix is a vector). `m[1]` is 1. 
Error: `nrow` on vector. 
Code: `nrow(c(1, 2))`. 
Error: Returns `NULL` (vectors don't have rows/dim). 
Let's try: `class` usage error. 
Code: `if (class(x) == "numeric")`. 
Error: `class(x)` might return vector of strings (e.g. `c("glm", "lm")`). Should use `inherits(x, "numeric")` or `is.numeric(x)`.

title: Class Check Safety
codeSnippet:
model <- lm(y ~ x, data = df)
if (class(model) == "lm") print("Fit")
explanation: Checking `class(x) == "string"` is unsafe because objects can have multiple classes. Use `inherits(model, "lm")` or `is(model, "lm")`.

title: Attributes
explanation: True. Returns names, row.names, class.

title: In Operator
explanation: Standard `in` operator doesn't exist for value check. Use `%in%`.

title: Match Function
explanation: True. Returns index 2.

title: Transpose Function
explanation: Function is `t()`, not `transpose`.

title: Range Function
explanation: True. Returns c(1, 5) (min, max).

title: Str Function Typo
explanation: Standard structure inspection function is `str()`, not `struct`.

title: Diag Matrix
explanation: True. Creates 2x2 identity matrix.

title: Nrow on List
explanation: `nrow` returns `NULL` for lists (they are 1D). Data frames (which are lists) have rows.

title: Lower Case
explanation: True. Returns "hi".

title: Combine lists
codeSnippet:
l1 <- list(1)
l2 <- list(2)
c(l1, l2)
explanation:
Valid. Returns a combined list of length 2. 
Error: `$` on vector. 
Code: `v <- c(1); v$a`. 
Error: `$` operator is invalid for atomic vectors.

title: Dollar on Vector
explanation: `$` operator cannot be used on atomic vectors, even named ones. Use `v["a"]`.

title: Is Vector
explanation: True. Lists are 'generic vectors'. `is.atomic()` is FALSE.

title: Setwd path escape
explanation: Backslash usage requires escaping: `"C:\\Data"` or use typesafe `"C:/Data"`.

title: Get working directory
explanation: True.

title: Logic Not Operator
explanation: `not` is not a keyword. Use `!`.

title: Modulo Operator
explanation: True. Returns 1.

title: Integer Division
explanation: `//` is comment start in other languages or floor div in Python. R used `%/%` for integer division.

title: Floor Function
explanation: True. Returns 1.

title: Missing comma in dataframe
explanation: Arguments must be separated by commas.

title: Table Frequency
explanation: True. Counts occurrences.

title: Invalid Column Name Assignment
explanation:
Valid usage (standard replacement). 
Error: `row.names` assignment size mismatch. 
Code: `row.names(df) <- 1:(nrow(df)+1)`. 
Error: Lengths differ. 
Let's try: `plot` arguments `main` title string without quotes? No. 
Error: `function` definition without body braces? 
Code: `f <- function(x) x + 1`. Valid. 
Real Error: `return` outside function. 
Code: `if(x) return(1)`. 
Error: `return()` generally used inside functions. If used in script at top level, it stops execution (valid in `source()`). But usually flagged as warning in IDE if not in fun. 
Let's try: `c(1, "a")` type assumption. 
Code: `x <- c(1, "a") + 1`. 
Error: Non-numeric argument to binary operator (x is character).

title: Coercion Arithmetic
explanation: `c(1, "2")` coerces 1 to "1", creating character vector `c("1", "2")`. Arithmetic `+` is not defined for characters.

title: Ncol Function
explanation: True. Returns 1.

title: List element name no quotes
explanation: `var-name` (with minus) is not a valid identifier. Must be quoted: `list("var-name" = 1)`.

title: Sapply Simplify
explanation: True. Returns vector.

title: Assign to function
explanation:
Actually... `length(x) <- 5` IS VALID. It resizes the vector (pads with NAs or truncates). 
Error: Assign to `c()`? 
Code: `c(x, y) <- 1`. 
Error: Incorrect assignment. `c()` cannot be on LHS.

title: Assignment to Combine
explanation: Cannot assign to `c(...)` function call. R does not support destructuring assignment syntax like this (need libraries or multiple lines).

title: Is Numeric
explanation: True.

title: Unclosed quote
explanation: Missing closing quote.

title: Exp Function
explanation: True. (e^1).

title: Plot main arg typo
explanation: Standard plot title argument is `main`, not `title`. `title` is often ignored or passed to `...` without effect on base plot title.

title: Log Function
explanation: True. Returns 1 (natural log).

title: Data Frame subset comma
explanation:
`df[1]` returns first COLUMN (as data frame). `df[1, ]` returns first row. Syntactically valid but often user logic error if they wanted row. 
Real Error: `df[[1, 2]]` usage. 
Code: `df[[1, 2]]`. 
Error: Invalid subscript type/syntax for `[[`. `[[` selects single element. `[[row, col]]`... actually `[[vector]]` selects recursive. `[[row, col]]` syntax is usually invalid for dataframe unless recursive list structure? 
Better error: `if` on vector. 
Code: `if (c(TRUE, FALSE)) {}`. 
Error: Condition has length > 1 (warning/error in recent R).

title: If Condition Length
explanation: Condition has length > 1. Only the first element will be used (and in recent R versions <= 4.2+ this is an Error, previously a Warning).

title: Nchar Function
explanation: True. Returns 3.

title: Library quotes optional
explanation:
Valid. Quotes are optional. 
Error: `install.packages` NO quotes? 
Code: `install.packages(dplyr)`. 
Error: Object `dplyr` not found (must use string).

title: Install Packages Quotes
explanation: Must use string for package name: `install.packages("ggplot2")`. Without quotes, it looks for object `ggplot2`.

title: Args Function
explanation: True. Displays arguments.

title: Invalid Identifier Number
explanation: Variable names cannot start with a number.

title: Sys Date
explanation: True. Returns current date.

title: Apply Margin
explanation: Margin 3 is invalid for a 2D matrix. Use 1 (rows) or 2 (cols).

title: Tapply Function
explanation: True. Returns sum per group.

title: Merge without by
codeSnippet:
df1 <- data.frame(id = 1, val = 2)
df2 <- data.frame(id = 1, val2 = 3)
merge(df1, df2)
explanation:
Valid. `merge` defaults to using intersecting column names (`id`) for natural join. 
Error: `aggregate` formula syntax. 
Code: `aggregate(y ~ x, data = df)`. Valid. 
Real Error: `subset` assignment. 
Code: `subset(df, x > 0) <- NA`. 
Error: `subset()` returns a value, cannot assign to it (not an lvalue wrapper like `names()<-`). use `df[x > 0, ] <- NA`.

title: Subset Assignment
explanation: `subset()` cannot be used on the left-hand side of an assignment. Use subscripting `df[df$x > 0, ] <- NA`.

title: With Function
explanation: True. Evaluates expression within data environment.

title: TryCatch syntax
explanation:
Valid syntax. 
Error: `try` vs `tryCatch`. 
Real Error: `function` passed to `apply` without args? 
Code: `apply(m, 1, mean, na.rm=TRUE)`. Valid. 
Let's try: `do.call` first arg. 
Code: `do.call("sum", 1:5)`. 
Error: `do.call` expects a list of arguments as second parameter. `1:5` is a vector, not a list of args? Actually `args` must be a list. `do.call` documentation: "args: a list of arguments". If passed vector, it might act as list (since vector... list is vector?). But `1:5` integers. 
Does `do.call` work with vector? 
It expects `args` to be list. 
Error: `args` must be a list.

title: Do Call Arguments
explanation: `do.call` expects a **list** of arguments as the second parameter. `c(1, 2, 3)` is an atomic vector. Use `as.list(c(1, 2, 3))` or `list(1, 2, 3)`.

title: Complete Cases
explanation: True. Filters rows with no NAs.

title: Cut labels length
explanation: Breaks = 2 implies 2 intervals. Labels provided: 3. Lengths must match.

title: Factors Relevel
explanation: True. Moves "b" to first level.

title: Assign to class function
explanation:
Valid S3 class assignment. 
Error: `UseMethod` usage outside function? 
Code: `UseMethod("print")`. 
Error: `UseMethod` used in a generic function body, not top level? If top level, context unclear. 
Real Error: `for` argument loop var modification? 
Code: `for(i in 1:5) { i <- 10 }`. Valid (local copy). 
Let's try: `switch` usage. 
Code: `switch("a", a=1, b=2)`. Valid. 
Code: `switch(1, a=1, b=2)`. Warning/Error? Returns first arg. 
Error: `require` error handling. 
Code: `if (require("pkg") == FALSE) stop()`. Valid. 
Real Error: `return` multiple values. 
Code: `return(1, 2)`. 
Error: `return` accepts only one argument. To return multiple, use a list.

title: Return Multiple Values
explanation: `return()` takes a single argument. To return multiple values, wrap them in a `list()` or vector `c()`.

title: Mapply basics
explanation: True. Sums element-wise (1+1, 2+2, 3+3).

title: Split syntax
explanation:
`f` (grouping factor) must have same length as data X. `length(5)` is 1? No 5 is length 1. `split` recycles but warning if length not multiple. If lengths mismatch badly (e.g. 10 vs 3), it warns. 
Real Error: `na.omit` on vector? Valid. 
Error: `grep` `value=TRUE` returns strings. 
Code: `grep("a", x, value=TRUE)`. Valid. 
Let's try: `list` argument name in `data.frame`. 
Code: `data.frame(x = 1, x = 2)`. 
Error/Warning: Duplicate column names allowed but `check.names=TRUE` by default mangles them (`x` and `x.1`). 
Error: `<<-` global assign to undefined? 
Code: `f <- function() { x <<- 1 }`. 
If `x` not defined globally, it creates it globally. Valid. 
Error: `readRDS` file arg. 
Code: `x <- readRDS(file="data")`. Valid. 
Real Error: `file` connection not closed. 
Code: `f <- file("x"); writeLines("a", f);`. 
Missing `close(f)`. Logical error. 
Hard to show in snippet. 
Let's try: `...` usage in non-variadic fun. 
Code: `f <- function(x) { list(...) }`.

title: Ellipsis in Fixed Function
explanation: `...` used in body but not defined in function signature `function(x, ...)`.

title: Do Call
explanation: True. Equivalent to `paste("A", "B", sep="-")`.

title: Dump multiple objects
explanation:
Valid. 
Error: `saveRDS` multiple objects? 
Code: `saveRDS(x, y, file="f")`. 
Error: `saveRDS` saves a SINGLE object. (Use `save()` for multiple). `saveRDS(object, file = ...)`.

title: SaveRDS Multiple Objects
explanation: `saveRDS` saves a single R object. To save multiple objects, use `save(x, y, file = ...)` or put them in a list `saveRDS(list(x, y), ...)`.

title: Scan function
explanation: True. Reads data into vector.

title: Missing package check
explanation: If package doesn't exist, `library()` throws generic error. `require()` returns FALSE. Warning/Style: unsafe without check.

title: Gsub Global
explanation: True. Returns "bbnbnb".

title: Sapply argument order
explanation:
Valid (named args). 
Error: `apply` on vector. 
Code: `apply(1:5, 1, sum)`. 
Error: `apply` requires an array/matrix with dimensions. Vector has NULL dim. Error: "dim(X) must have a positive length".

title: Apply on Vector
explanation: `apply` requires an object with dimensions (matrix/array). Vectors do not have dimensions by default (unless `dim(v)` is set). Use `sapply` or `lapply` for vectors.

title: AnyNA Function
explanation: True. Faster than `any(is.na(x))`.

title: Closure assignment
explanation: `i <- i + 1` creates a LOCAL variable `i` inside the inner function (shadowing the outer `i`). The outer `i` is not updated. Use superassignment `<<-` to update the closure variable: `i <<- i + 1`.

title: Identical Function
explanation: True. 1 is numeric (double) by default.

title: Eval string directly
explanation: `eval` expects an expression, not a string. Must parse first: `eval(parse(text = "1 + 1"))`.

title: Within Function
explanation: True. Returns modified data frame.

title: For Loop Vector modification
explanation: Loop variable `i` is a copy of elements. Modifying `i` does not modify `x`. Iterate by index to modify `x`: `for (j in seq_along(x)) x[j] <- ...`.

title: Duplicated Function
explanation: True. Returns c(FALSE, TRUE, FALSE).

title: Next in apply
explanation: `next` is used in loops (`for`, `while`). `sapply` applies a FUNCTION. Inside the function, there is no loop to `next`. Use `return(NULL)` or similar.

title: Source Function
explanation: True. Executes file.

title: System Time syntax
explanation:
Valid. 
Error: `rm` multiple args as vector? 
Code: `rm(c("x", "y"))`. 
Error: `rm` expects names as arguments `rm(x, y)` or `list` argument `rm(list = c("x", "y"))`. `rm("x")` removes object named "x". `rm(c("x", "y"))` looks for object named `c`, "x", ... no, `rm(...)` objects to be removed. `rm("x")` is valid. `rm(c("x", "y"))` attempts to remove object named `c`, `x`, `y`? No, it evaluates args? `...` objects. 
`rm(x)` -> removes object x. 
`rm("x")` -> removes object x. 
`rm(c("x", "y"))` -> evaluates `c("x", "y")` -> produces character vector. Removes object named... wait. 
Docs: `...` the objects to be removed... names are given as character strings... 
Wait. 
usage `rm(x)` works. `rm("x")` works. 
`rm(c("x", "y"))` might look for object with that vector as name? 
Correct usage for character vector: `rm(list = vector)`. 
Error: `rm(c("x", "y"))` does NOT remove x and y. It looks for object corresponding to first arg?

title: Remove Character Vector
explanation: `rm(vars)` removes the object `vars` (the vector), not the objects named "x" and "y". To remove objects specified by a character vector, use `rm(list = vars)`.

title: List Names
explanation: True. Returns "a".

title: Missing argument handling
explanation: Function prints "Missing", but then proceeds to evaluate `x + 1`. Since `x` is missing and has no default, this throws an error 'argument "x" is missing, with no default'. Execution does not stop at `missing()` check.

title: On Exit
explanation: True. `on.exit` runs even if error occurs.

title: Switch no default
explanation:
If no match found, returns `NULL` invisibly. Not strictly error, but logic flaw if default expected. 
Better error: `file.exists` vector support. 
Code: `file.exists(c("a", "b"))`. Valid (returns vector). 
Real Error: `ifelse` returns value. 
Code: `ifelse(test, x, y)`. Type consistency? 
Let's try: `attach` usage warning. 
Code: `attach(df); attach(df)`. 
Error: objects masked. 
Real Error: `numeric` vs `double` precision check `x == 0.3`. 
Code: `0.1 + 0.2 == 0.3`. 
Error: Returns FALSE due to floating point. (Already done in other languages, but relevant in R/Stats).

title: Equality Floating Point
explanation: Floating point arithmetic inaccuracy. `0.1 + 0.2` is slightly not equal to `0.3`. Use `all.equal()` or `abs(a-b) < tol`.

title: Options Width
explanation: True. Sets output width.

title: Vector name attributes null
explanation:
Valid (removes names). 
Error: `class` vs `col_types` in `read.csv`. 
Code: `read.csv("f", colClasses=c("numeric"))`. Valid. 
Real Error: `set.seed` local? 
Code: `f <- function() { set.seed(1); runif(1) }`. Valid. 
Error: `sample` with 1 arg behavior. 
Code: `sample(x)`. Valid (permutation). 
Code: `sample(10)`. Valid (1:10 perm). 
Code: `x <- 10; sample(x[x > 20])`. 
If `x[x>20]` is empty (length 0), `sample` behavior? 
If length is 1? 
Issue: `sample(x)` where `x` is numeric vector of length 1. `sample(10)` samples from `1:10`! 
Snippet: `sample(x)` where `x` holds 10.

title: Sample Length 1 Ambiguity
explanation: When `sample` receives a single numeric argument `x` >= 1, it treats it as `1:x` (sampling from 1 to 10), not sampling THE value 10. Use `sample(x, 1)` or explicit `sample.int` to avoid ambiguity.

title: Unlist
explanation: True. Returns named vector.

title: S4 Class Slot Access
explanation: S4 objects use `@` for slot access (`obj@slotName`), not `$`. `$` is for lists/environments/S3.

title: Set Class
explanation: True. Sets S3 class.

title: Setdiff arguments
explanation:
Valid. Returns 1. 
Error: `union` of data frames? 
Code: `union(df1, df2)`. Valid (dplyr/base handles?). Base R `union` coerces to vector? No, handles data frames since recent versions. 
Real Error: `assign` envir missing default? 
Code: `assign("x", 1)`. Valid (current env). 
Error: `<<-` at top level. 
Code: `x <<- 1`. 
Error: `<<-` searches parent environments. At top level (global), it assigns to global (same as `<-`). Not an error, but bad style? 
Actually, `<<-` at global level is valid. 
Let's try: `return` inside `lapply`. 
Code: `lapply(x, function(i) return(i))`. Valid. 
Real Error: `break` out of `apply`. 
Code: `apply(m, 1, function(x) { if(x[1]>0) break })`. 
Error: Cannot break out of `apply` loop (it's a function call).

title: Break inside Apply
explanation: `break` only works inside loops (`for`, `while`). `apply` executes a function; `break` is invalid inside that function context.

title: Gregexpr
explanation: True. Global Regex match positions.

title: ReadLines connection
explanation:
If file was read to end, second call returns empty character vector. Not error, but maybe unexpected. 
Real Error: `close` missing? 
Code: `con <- file("f"); x<-readLines(con)`. 
Error: Connection `con` left open. Resource leak.

title: Unclosed Connection
explanation: Function returns without closing connection `con`. Use `on.exit(close(con))` or explicitly close it.

title: Invisible Return
explanation: True. x becomes 1, but result not printed if not assigned.

title: Deparse usage
explanation:
Valid. 
Error: `bquote` interpolation. 
Code: `x <- 1; bquote(.(x) + 1)`. Valid. 
Code: `bquote(x + 1)`. Returns symbol x + 1. 
Real Error: `::` for non-exported? 
Code: `pkg::internal_fun`. 
Error: `::` accesses exported. Use `:::` for internal.

title: Internal Function Access
explanation:
Valid syntax `:::`. 
Error: `::` for internal. 
Code: `stats::.Diff`. 
Error: `.Diff` is likely internal (starts with dot) and not exported. `::` fails if not exported.

title: Get Function
explanation: True. Returns the function object.

title: Is S4 check
explanation:
Valid (returns FALSE). 
Error: `new` for S3? 
Code: `new("data.frame")`. 
Error: `new()` is for S4 classes. `data.frame` is S3.

title: New for S3
explanation: `new()` is used to create S4 objects. `data.frame` is an S3 class. Use constructor function `data.frame()` or `structure()`.

title: Options StringsAsFactors
explanation: True. (Deprecated defaults in R 4.0, but valid code).

title: C bind lists
codeSnippet:
l <- list(data.frame(a=1), data.frame(a=2))
df <- do.call(cbind, l)
explanation:
Valid (binds columns). `rbind` binds rows. 
Error: `rbind` data frames with different columns? 
Code: `rbind(df1, df2)` where columns mismatch. 
Error: "names do not match previous names".

title: Rbind Mismatch
codeSnippet:
df1 <- data.frame(a=1)
df2 <- data.frame(b=2)
rbind(df1, df2)
explanation: `rbind` requires data frames to have matching column names (unless using specialized bind like `dplyr::bind_rows`).

title: Structure
explanation: True. Creates object with attributes.

title: Formula as string
explanation: `lm` expects a formula object, not a string. Use `as.formula("y ~ x")` or just `y ~ x`.

title: Body Function
explanation: True. Returns function body expression.

title: UseMethod arguments
explanation: `UseMethod` should be called in the GENERIC function (`print`), not the METHOD (`print.myclass`). The method implements the logic.

title: Missing Function
explanation: True. Checks if argument provided.

title: As Date Format Year
explanation: `%y` (lowercase) is for 2-digit years. `2023` is 4-digits, requiring `%Y` (uppercase).

title: Options Scipen
explanation: True. Discourages scientific notation.

title: Inherits vs Is
explanation:
Valid. 
Error: `sweep` stats length mismatch. 
Code: `m<-matrix(1:4,2,2); sweep(m, 1, 1:3, "+")`. 
Error: Stats length (3) does not match margin length (2). `sweep` recycles, but warning/error if not multiple. 
Real Error: `pmin` on matrix? 
Code: `pmin(m1, m2)`. Valid (element-wise). 
Real Error: `ifelse` returning list? 
Code: `ifelse(TRUE, list(1), list(2))`. 
Error: `ifelse` strips attributes and expects vector return. Lists are not preserved well or return first element? 
Issue: `ifelse` result is atomic vector usually. If args are lists, behavior is confusing/wrong. 
But strict error? 
Let's try: `formula` arithmetic. 
Code: `lm(y ~ x + z^2)`. 
Error: `^` in formula means interaction/crossing, not power. Use `I(z^2)`.

title: Formula Arithmetic
explanation: In formulas, `^` represents interaction expansion (like `*`). To perform arithmetic power, wrap in `I()`: `y ~ x + I(z^2)`.

title: Pmax Function
explanation: True. Returns c(5, 10).

title: Try expression
explanation: `x` is an object of class `"try-error"`. Comparing it directly to string `"try-error"` works if it IS the string, but `try` returns an object with class attribute. `x` itself contains the error message. Use `inherits(x, "try-error")`.

title: Suppress Warnings
explanation: True. Returns NaN without warning.

title: Update formula remove
explanation:
Valid. 
Error: `aggregate` without FUN? 
Code: `aggregate(x ~ g, data=df)`. 
Error: Argument `FUN` is missing, with no default. 
Real Error: `order` decreasing typo. 
Code: `order(x, desc=TRUE)`. 
Error: Argument is `decreasing`, not `desc`.

title: Order Argument
explanation: `order` parameter is `decreasing`, not `desc`. `dplyr::arrange` uses `desc()` helper.

title: Outer Product
explanation: True. Returns multiplication table.

title: Sample Int
explanation:
`sample.int` expects integer `n`. 10.5 is truncated to 10? Yes. 
Error: `set.seed` with string? 
Code: `set.seed("123")`. 
Error: `set.seed` requires a number. 
Real Error: `dev.off` when null. 
Code: `dev.off()`. 
If no device, error: "cannot shut down device 1 (the null device)".

title: Null Device Off
explanation: Calling `dev.off()` when no graphics device is open (only null device) throws an error.

title: Environment Parent
explanation: True. Returns parent environment (usually last attached package).

title: Formals assignment check
explanation:
Valid (changes default arg). 
Error: `list2env` target mismatch. 
Code: `list2env(l, envir=1)`. 
Error: `envir` must be an environment (not number/position unless using `as.environment`?). `list2env` specifically asks for `envir`. 
Real Error: `get` with default? 
Code: `get("x", default=NULL)`. 
Error: `get` does not have a `default` argument. Typically throws error if not found. Use `mget` or `exists`.

title: Get Default Argument
explanation: `get()` does not have a `default` parameter. It errors if object not found. Use `mget(..., ifnotfound = ...)` or check `exists()`.

title: Sweep Function
explanation: True. Subtracts (default op) vector from rows.

title: Exists envir
explanation:
Valid (`where` accepts search pos/name). 
Error: `model.matrix` response inclusion? 
Code: `model.matrix(y ~ x, df)`. 
Includes intercept column. Valid. 
Real Error: `rank` argument `ties.method`. 
Code: `rank(x, ties.method="average")`. Valid. 
Code: `rank(x, ties="average")`. 
Error: Argument is `ties.method`.

title: Rank Ties Argument
explanation: Argument name is `ties.method`, not `ties`.

title: Model Matrix
explanation: True. Generates design matrix (intercept + columns).

title: Hist breaks invalid
explanation: Breaks cannot be negative.

title: Runif Function
explanation: True. 5 uniform random numbers [0,1].

title: Par global set
explanation:
Valid. 
Error: `lines` before `plot`? 
Code: `lines(x, y)`. 
Error: `plot.new` has not been called yet. `lines` adds to EXISTING plot. If no plot, error.

title: Lines before Plot
explanation: `lines()` adds to an existing plot. If no plot has been initialized (e.g., via `plot()`), it throws an error "plot.new has not been called yet".

title: Set Seed Scope
codeSnippet:
f <- function() { set.seed(1); runif(1) }
f() == f()
explanation: True. `set.seed` sets global RNG state.

title: List2Env Envir
explanation:
Valid. 
Error: `ls` pattern regex invalid? 
Code: `ls(pattern = "[")`. 
Error: Invalid regexp. 
Real Error: `stopifnot` single arg? 
Code: `stopifnot(TRUE)`. Valid. 
Code: `stopifnot(1)`. 
Error: `stopifnot` - results must be all TRUE (logical). 1 is numeric. Coerced? 
Docs: "expressions which should evaluate to logical TRUE". 
`if (1)` works. `stopifnot`... "all elements must be TRUE". 
It checks `all(expr)`. `all(1)` -> 1 (coerced). 1 is treated as True in `if` but `all` on numeric returns... numeric. 
R Logic: `all(c(1, 1))` -> 1. 
`if (!all(..))` 
`!1` -> FALSE. 
So `stopifnot` on numeric might act weird but pass? 
Let's try: `merge` all.x typo. 
Code: `merge(x, y, all_x = TRUE)`. 
Error: Argument is `all.x` (dot).

title: Merge Argument Name
explanation: Argument is `all.x`, not `all_x`.

title: Aggregate formula
explanation: True. Groups by cyl and gear.

title: Update with data usage
codeSnippet:
m <- lm(y ~ x, data = df)
m2 <- update(m, data = df2)
explanation:
Valid (updates call). 
Error: `t` on vector returns row vector? 
Code: `t(1:3)`. Returns 1x3 matrix. 
Real Error: `rowSums` on list. 
Code: `rowSums(list(1, 2))`. 
Error: 'x' must be an array of at least two dimensions.

title: RowSums on List
explanation: `rowSums` requires a numeric matrix or array (or data frame), not a list.

title: Rank ties
explanation: True. Returns c(1, 2, 3).

title: ColMeans numeric check
explanation: `colMeans` requires numeric data. String column causes error.

title: Sample Replace
explanation: True. Necessary when sample size > population.

title: Duplicate row names warning
explanation: Duplicate row.names are not allowed in data frames.

title: Nlevels
explanation: True. Returns 26.

title: Scale center logic
explanation: `center` argument takes logical (`TRUE`/`FALSE`) or a numeric vector (to subtract), not a string method name.

title: Cumsum
explanation: True. Returns c(1, 3, 6).

title: Plot pch string
explanation: `pch` accepts integer code (e.g., 1 for circle) or a single character (e.g., "o"). "circle" is not a valid single character or code.

title: Strsplit
explanation: True. Splits on literal dot.

title: Arg match error
explanation: "x" does not match "a" or "b". Throws error.

title: File paths
explanation: True. Returns "A/B" (platform independent sep check).

title: Setwd non-existent
explanation: Throws error: cannot change working directory.

title: Dir Exists
explanation: True.

title: Function default eval
codeSnippet:
f <- function(x = y) { y <- 1; x }
f()
explanation:
Valid! (Lazy evaluation). `x` is evaluated when used. `y` is looked up. `y` exists in function scope = 1. Returns 1. 
Error: `force` usage? 
Code: `f <- function(x) { force(y); x }`. Error: y not found. 
Real Error: `detach` argument char? 
Code: `detach("package:stats")`. 
Error: `detach` expects a name or index, or character if `character.only=TRUE`. `detach(package:stats)` (symbol) works. `detach("package:stats")` fails without `character.only=TRUE`? 
Actually docs say: "name: The object to detach... can be an unquoted name or a character string..." 
Wait. "If a character string is supplied for name, character.only argument is ignored? No?" 
Actually `detach("package:stats")` works. 
Let's try: `rm` environment. 
Code: `rm(list=ls(), envir=NULL)`. 
Error: `envir` must be environment. NULL invalid.

title: Rm Environment Null
explanation: `envir` must be an object of class `environment`. `NULL` is not an environment.

title: Quote Function
explanation: True. Returns unevaluated language object.

title: Pmatch NA
explanation:
Valid (returns NA). 
Error: `switch` with numeric 0? 
Code: `switch(0, "a")`. Returns NULL. Valid. 
Real Error: `interaction` factors length mismatch. 
Code: `interaction(f1, f2)`. If lengths differ? Error. 
Code: `f1 <- factor(1:2); f2 <- factor(1:3); interaction(f1, f2)`. 
Error: arguments must have same length.

title: Interaction Length Mismatch
explanation: Vectors/Factors combined with `interaction` must have the same length.

title: Expand Grid
explanation: True. Creates Cartesian product data frame.

title: Set equal list info
explanation:
Valid. 
Error: `duplicated` on environment? 
Code: `duplicated(new.env())`. Error/Fail? 
Real Error: `rle` on unsorted? Valid (runs). 
Real Error: `stop` with multiple args? 
Code: `stop("Error ", "occurred")`. 
Valid (calls `paste`). 
Error: `warning` immediate? 
Code: `warning("Msg", immediate=TRUE)`. 
Error: Argument `immediate.` (dot) exists. `immediate=TRUE` might fail partial match or be unused? 
Parameter is `immediate.`.

title: Warning Parameter
explanation: The parameter is named `immediate.`, not `immediate`.

title: List Env Conversion
explanation: True. Converts env to list.

title: Sub assignment strings
explanation:
Valid substr assignment! 
Error: `grep` `fixed=T` with regex char? 
Code: `grep(".", "abc", fixed=TRUE)`. 
Returns 0 (no dot in "abc"). Not error. 
Real Error: `rep` `times` and `each` usage. 
Code: `rep(1:2, times=2, each=2)`. Valid details. 
Length 8. 
Error: `rnorm` negative sd. 
Code: `rnorm(1, sd = -1)`. 
Error: standard deviation must be non-negative.

title: Negative Standard Deviation
explanation: Standard deviation `sd` cannot be negative. Returns NaNs.

title: ColClasses
explanation: True. Recycles class if only one spec.

title: Format digits
explanation: `digits` must be non-negative (usually >= 0 or 1).

title: Sys Info
explanation: True. Returns OS name.

title: Diff on char
explanation: `diff` requires numeric/date/time vector. Character vector operations not supported.

title: Find Interval
explanation: True. Returns 1 (index of lower bound).

title: Xtab formula
explanation: `xtabs` requires a formula as the first argument (e.g., `freq ~ .`).

title: Assign Environment
explanation: True. Assigns global variable.

title: Stop if not result
explanation: `stopifnot` returns NULL (invisibly) or throws error. It does not return TRUE. Assigning result to `x` sets `x` to NULL, which is often not intended if users expect logical.

title: File Info
explanation: True. Checks if directory.

title: On Exit Add
explanation: Second `on.exit` overwrites the first. Prints only "B". To accumulate handlers, use `add = TRUE` in the second call: `on.exit(..., add = TRUE)`.

title: Typeof vs Class
explanation: True. Data frames are lists with class "data.frame".

title: Match Call usage
explanation:
Valid. Returns `f(x = 1, y = 2)`. 
Error: `lockBinding` on non-existant? 
Code: `lockBinding("z", globalenv())`. Error. 
Real Error: `delayedAssign` eval. 
Code: `delayedAssign("x", print("Exec")); x`. 
Prints "Exec". Valid. 
Real Error: `makeActiveBinding` fun args. 
Code: `makeActiveBinding("x", function() 1, env)`. Valid. 
Code: `makeActiveBinding("x", function(v) v, env)`. Valid (getter/setter). 
Code: `makeActiveBinding("x", 1, env)`. 
Error: `fun` must be a function.

title: Active Binding Function
explanation: `makeActiveBinding` requires a FUNCTION as the second argument, not a value.

title: Pairlist check
explanation: True. Function formals are stored as pairlists.

title: Substitute in Global
explanation:
In global env, `substitute(x)` returns `x` (symbol) if `env` not spec? No, returns value? 
Docs: "Substitute returns the parse tree... `substitute(x)` returns `x` (symbol)." 
Wait. `substitute(1)` returns 1. `substitute(x)` returns `x`. 
However, if inside function `f(x=1)`, `substitute(x)` returns 1. 
Strictly speaking `substitute(x)` at global level returns `x` (symbol). Not error. 
Real Error: `sys.frame` negative index? 
Code: `sys.frame(-1)`. Valid (counts from top). 
Real Error: `mclapply` on Windows. 
Code: `parallel::mclapply(1:10, fun, mc.cores=2)`. 
On Windows, `mc.cores` > 1 is ignored/not supported (returns 1 core). Not error, but limitation. 
Let's try: `bquote` splicing. 
Code: `bquote( .(x) )`. Valid. 
Code: `bquote( ..(x) )`? `..` is not standard base R bquote syntax? (It is in `rlang`). Base uses `.(x)`. 
Snippet: `bquote(..(x))`.

title: Base Bquote Splicing
explanation: Base R `bquote` uses `.(x)` for unquoting. `!!x` or `..` are used in `rlang`/`tidyverse`. `..(x)` evaluates to... valid syntax but `list`? No, likely interpreted as symbol `..` call. In base bquote, it doesn't splice. Expects `.(x)`.

title: Mode vs Class
explanation: True. Underlying storage mode of factor is numeric (integer codes).

title: Tracemem copy
explanation:
Valid. Triggers message if copy. 1L preserves integer, might validly modify in place. 
Error: `reg.finalizer` on non-environment? 
Code: `reg.finalizer(list(1), function(e) print("Done"))`. 
Error: `reg.finalizer` can only be used on environment objects (or external pointers).

title: Reg Finalizer Type
explanation: Finalizers can only be registered on **environment** objects or external pointers, not basic lists.

title: Sys Call
explanation: True. Returns the call `f()`.

title: Unlock binding locked
explanation: Cannot change value of locked binding. Must `unlockBinding` first.

title: Body assignment
explanation: True. f() now returns 2.

title: Raw connection binary
explanation:
Valid, reads text from raw bytes (if valid char). 
Error: `socketConnection` server loop without loop. 
Code: `server <- socketConnection(server=TRUE, port=0)`. 
Wait. `rawConnection` works on raw vector. 
Let's try: `serialize` usage. 
Code: `serialize(x, connection=NULL)`. Returns raw vector. 
Real Error: `load` on RDS file? 
Code: `saveRDS(x, "f.rds"); load("f.rds")`. 
Error: `load` expects a file saved with `save()`. `saveRDS` files must be read with `readRDS()`. `load` will error "bad restore file magic number".

title: Load RDS File
explanation: `load` expects a binary file created by `save`. `saveRDS` creates a serialization of a single object (RDS). Use `readRDS("file.rds")`.

title: Recursive function memory
explanation:
Valid (throws error 'evaluation nested too deeply'). 
Error: `call` construction arg name. 
Code: `call("mean", x=1:10)`. 
Valid. 
Real Error: `Recall` outside function. 
Code: `Recall(1)`. 
Error: 'Recall' used outside a function.

title: Recall Outside Function
explanation: `Recall` calls the enclosing function recursively. It cannot be used outside of a function body.

title: Lazy Loading
explanation: True. Error only occurs if `x` is evaluated later.

title: Browser condition
explanation:
`browser` takes `expr` (to eval) and `condition` (expr). Logic: if condition is true, enter browser. Syntax is valid. 
Real Error: `environment` of primitive. 
Code: `environment(sum)`. 
Primitives do not have environments. Returns NULL. 
Code: `environment(sum) <- globalenv()`. 
Error: cannot set environment of a primitive function.

title: Environment of Primitive
explanation: `sum` is a primitive function. Primitives do not have associated environments, and you cannot set one.

title: Interactive Check
explanation: True. Checks if R is running interactively.

title: Source local true
explanation:
Valid (evals in calling env). 
Error: `message` format arguments? 
Code: `message("Value: %d", 1)`. 
Error: `message` simply concatenates (`...`). It does NOT support `sprintf` style formatting efficiently. It outputs "Value: %d 1". Not strict error. 
Real Error: `sprintf` argument mismatch. 
Code: `sprintf("%d %s", 1)`. 
Error: too few arguments.

title: Sprintf Arguments
explanation: Format string expects 2 arguments (%d and %s), but only 1 provided.

title: Is Atomic
explanation: False. Lists are 'recursive' objects, not atomic vectors (like int, dbl, chr).

title: Switch string exact
explanation:
Valid (exact match). 
Error: `methods` usage on object. 
Code: `methods(1)`. 
Error: `methods` expects a GENERIC function name or class (optional). It finds methods FOR a function or class. `1` is object. `methods(class="numeric")` works (S3). 
Snippet: `methods(1)`.

title: Methods Argument
explanation: `methods` expects a function name (character or symbol) or class name. `10` is a raw value.

title: Find Package
explanation: True. Returns environment name (e.g. "package:base").

title: Class S3 double assignment
explanation:
Valid (internal setter). 
Error: `NextMethod` usage basic. 
Code: `NextMethod()`. 
Valid inside method. 
Real Error: `I` usage outside formula/data.frame? 
Code: `x <- I(1)`. Valid (adds class `AsIs`). 
Real Error: `inherits` multiple check. 
Code: `inherits(x, c("A", "B"))`. Valid (any match). 
Real Error: `seq_along` NULL. 
Code: `seq_along(NULL)`. Returns integer(0). Valid. 
Real Error: `rep` times negative. 
Code: `rep(1, -1)`. Error: invalid 'times' argument.

title: Rep Times Negative
explanation: `times` argument must be non-negative.

title: Global Assignment
explanation: True. Explicit global assignment.

title: Evalq quote redundant
explanation:
`evalq` quotes its argument automatically. `evalq(quote(x))` evaluates `quote(x)`, resulting in `symbol x`? Or `call quote(x)`? 
`evalq(expr)` -> `eval(quote(expr))`. 
`eval(quote(quote(x)))` -> `quote(x)`. 
So it returns the symbol x. Not error. 
Real Error: reference class method calling without `$`. 
RC is basic S4? 
Class `refClass`. 
Real Error: `validObject` check. 
Code: `validObject(1)`. Valid (TRUE). 
Real Error: `setClass` slots format. 
Code: `setClass("A", slots = c("numeric"))`. 
Error: slots must be NAMED vector. `c(x="numeric")`.

title: SetClass Slots
explanation: `slots` must be a **named** vector defining slot names and types. E.g., `slots = c(x = "numeric", flag = "logical")`.

title: Quote vs Substitute
explanation: True. `substitute` captures the expression passed to a function argument.

title: Function formals null
explanation: `sum` is Primitive. Cannot change formals of primitive functions.

title: Integrate Function
explanation: True. Returns integral value (approx 2).

title: Dput file binary
explanation:
`dput` writes ASCII text representation. Writing to binary connection likely confusing or error? Base `dput` works on text connections. 
Better: `readBin` size missing. 
Code: `readBin(con, "integer")`. 
Error: `n` usage? Defaults to 1. `size` default is 4 usually. 
Real Error: `seek` on non-file stream? 
Code: `seek(gzfile("f.gz"), 10)`. 
Error: `seek` is not supported on gzfile connections.

title: Seek Gzfile
explanation: `seek` is not supported for compressed file connections like `gzfile`, `bzfile`, etc.

title: Reduce Right
explanation: True. Processes from right to left.

title: Vectorize argument
explanation:
Valid syntax (though `sum` reduces... wait). 
`sum` takes `...`. 
`Vectorize(sum, "x")`. `sum` args: `..., na.rm`. There is no `x`. 
Error: 'x' must be a named argument of FUN? 
`Vectorize` matches args. If `x` not in formals? `sum` formals are NULL (primitive) or `...`. 
If formals are NULL, Vectorize might fail to find `x`. 
Error: argument 'x' must match an argument of FUN.

title: Vectorize Missing Arg
codeSnippet:
f <- function(a, b) a + b
v <- Vectorize(f, vectorize.args = "z")
explanation: `vectorize.args` must specify argument names present in `f`. "z" is not an argument of `f`.

title: Filter Function
explanation: True. Returns list(b=1).

title: Parse text vector
explanation:
Valid (returns expression length 2). 
Error: `call` first arg string? 
Code: `call("mean", x=1)`. Valid. 
Code: `call(mean, x=1)`. 
Error: `call` expects a CHARACTER string for function name. `call(mean, ...)` passes the FUNCTION object. `call` creates a call object `name(args)`. If first arg is function, it creates `(function(...) ...)(args)`. 
Actually `call` first arg name: "a character string naming the function to range over". 
If passing function object `mean`, error? 
Snippet: `call(mean, 1:10)`.

title: Call Function Syntax
explanation: `call` expects the function name as a **string** (character). Use `call("sum", 1:10)`.

title: Choose Function
explanation: True. Returns 10 (binomial coeff).

title: TryCatch finally return
explanation:
`return` inside finally overrides error? Yes. Returns 1. Valid syntax, but might mask error. Not strict error. 
Real Error: `rep.int` vs `rep`. 
`rep.int` is faster primitive. Arguments strict? 
Code: `rep.int(1, times=2)`. Valid. 
Code: `rep.int(1, each=2)`. 
Error: `rep.int` does NOT support `each`, `length.out`. Only `times`.

title: Rep Int Arguments
explanation: `rep.int` is a primitive that only supports the `times` argument. `each` is supported by the generic `rep`.

title: Rle Inverse
explanation: True. Reconstructs vector.

title: Sys.setenv named
explanation:
`Sys.setenv` takes named arguments `VAR = "1"` (value should be character, but coerced). 
Wait. `Sys.setenv("VAR"=1)` is named arg "VAR". Coercion works. 
Error: `Sys.unsetenv(c("A", "B"))`. Valid. 
Real Error: `options` getter multiple? 
Code: `options("width", "digits")`. 
Error: To get multiple options, pass a CHARACTER VECTOR? Or named args? 
Docs: `options(n1, n2)` returns list. Valid. 
Let's try: `get` with invalid mode. 
Code: `get("x", mode="numeric")`. Valid check. 
Real Error: `read.table` row.names duplicates in file? 
Real Error: `ts` frequency mismatch. 
Code: `ts(1:10, frequency = -1)`. Error. 
Real Error: `row.names` assignment length mismatch.

title: TS Frequency
explanation: Time series frequency must be positive.

title: UTF8 Int To Char
explanation: True. Returns "a".

title: Unserialize raw
explanation: `unserialize` expects a raw vector (from `serialize`) or a connection. It does not accept a character string.

title: Global Calling Handlers
explanation: True. Returns current handlers (or clears if assignment used). Calling with NULL returns list.

title: Debug primitive
explanation: Cannot `debug` primitive functions.

title: Memory Profile
explanation: True. Suspends profiling.

title: As Function env
explanation:
Valid (creates function with default a=1, body 2). 
Error: `DelayedArray`? (Bioc). 
Real Error: `socketSelect` list. 
Real Error: `bind_env`? 
Let's try: `aperm` dimensions mismatch. 
Code: `a <- array(1:8, 2:4); aperm(a, c(2, 1))`. 
Error: `perm` length must match array rank (3).

title: Aperm Dimensions
codeSnippet:
a <- array(1:8, dim = c(2, 2, 2))
aperm(a, c(2, 1))
explanation: `perm` vector length must match the number of dimensions of the array (3).

title: Recall Function
codeSnippet:
fact <- function(n) if(n<=1) 1 else n * Recall(n-1)
fact(5) == 120
explanation: True. `Recall` calls the recursive function anonymously.

title: Namespace operator assignment
explanation: Cannot assign into a namespace using `::`. This operator is read-only. Use `assignInNamespace` (advanced/hacky) or modify source.

title: Encoding Function
explanation: True. Sets string encoding mark.

title: SetClass Union
explanation: All classes in `members` must exist. "Unknown" class not defined.

title: Methods Function
explanation: True. Lists S3 methods for the class.

title: Slot accessing S3
explanation: `slot()` and `@` are for S4 objects. `data.frame` is S3. Use `attributes(df)$names` or `names(df)`.

title: Sys Getpid
explanation: True. Returns process ID.

title: CallCC usage
explanation:
Valid. Returns 1. 
Error: `deparse` control invalid? 
Code: `deparse(x, control="unknown")`. Error. 
Real Error: `comment` attribute non-string? 
Code: `comment(x) <- 1`. Valid (coerced). 
Real Error: `OldClass` S3 in S4 slot type? 
Real Error: defining S4 method without generic. 
Code: `setMethod("madeUpGeneric", ...)` 
Error: no generic function found.

title: SetMethod No Generic
explanation: Cannot set a method for a generic that doesn't exist. Must call `setGeneric("myNewMethod")` first.

title: Find Restart
explanation: True. Finds available restart (usually top-level).

title: Deparse formatting
explanation:
Valid. Use `width.cutoff` to control line breaking. 
Error: `system2` args string? 
Code: `system2("ls -l")`. 
Error: `system2` expects command and args separately. `system2("ls", "-l")`. `system` takes a single string. 
Real Error: `rpois` lambda negative. 
Code: `rpois(10, -1)`. Error. 
Real Error: `rm` non-character vector? 
Code: `vars <- c("x", "y"); rm(vars)`. 
Error: `rm` removes `vars` object. 
Wait, already used. 
Let's try: `assign` into locked env. 
Code: `assign("x", 1, envir=baseenv())`. 
Error: cannot assign to locked environment.

title: System2 Arguments
explanation: `system2` requires command and arguments to be passed separately: `system2("ls", "-l")`. Use `system("ls -l")` for single string commands.

title: LibPaths
explanation: True. Returns library paths.

title: Capture output file
explanation:
Valid (writes to stdout?). If file is NULL, returns character vector. If NA? If connection? If string name? 
Error: `sink` to connection that is closed? 
Real Error: `lockEnvironment` reverse? 
Code: `unlockEnvironment(env)`. 
Error: `unlockEnvironment` does not exist (in base R API generally, environment locking is one-way or C level). 
Wait, is there `unlockEnvironment`? No.

title: Unlock Environment
explanation: There is no `unlockEnvironment` function in base R. Environment locking is generally irreversible from R level.

title: CommandArgs
explanation: True. Returns user arguments excluding R binary/flags.

title: Stdin write
explanation: `stdin()` is a read-only connection. Cannot write to it.

title: Capabilities
explanation: True. Checks if PNG supported.

title: Sink type warning
explanation:
Closing sink with default `file=NULL`? `sink(file=NULL)` closes output sink. `sink(type="message")` requires a connection/file argument to divert messages. `sink()` (no args) usually closes output sink. 
To close message sink: `sink(type="message")` closes it? 
Docs: "sink(file = NULL, type = c("output", "message"))". 
`sink(type="message")` -> `file=NULL` -> closes message sink. Valid? 
Wait. `sink(type="message")` redirects to console (closes diversion). 
So no error? 
Real Error: `regexpr` incompatible inputs. 
Code: `regexpr(1, 2)`. Valid (coerced). 
Real Error: `parse` file and text. 
Code: `parse(file="f", text="s")`. 
Error: only one of 'file', 'text' or 'srcfile' can be used.

title: Parse File and Text
explanation: `parse` accepts either `file` OR `text` argument, not both simultaneously.

title: ShQuote
explanation: True. Return quoted string for shell ('file name.txt' or similar).

title: Tempfile creating dir
explanation:
Valid. 
Error: `file.exists` NULL? 
Code: `file.exists(NULL)`. Returns logical(0). 
Real Error: `file.rename` dest invalid. 
Real Error: `unzip` list. 
Code: `unzip("f.zip", list=TRUE)`. Valid. 
Real Error: `tar` compression invalid. 
Let's try: `eval` envir mismatch. 
Code: `eval(quote(x), envir=c(a=1))`. 
Error: `envir` must be environment or list (or NULL/pairlist). Character vector? No. `c(a=1)` is named number vector. 
If x is not found in vector, does it fail? It treats vector as... list-like? 
Docs: "envir: ... a list, a pairlist, an environment, or NULL". 
A logical/numeric vector is NOT valid (unless coercible to list? No). 
Code: `eval(1, envir=1:10)`. Error.

title: Eval Envir Type
explanation: `envir` must be an environment, list, or NULL. `c(x=1)` is a named numeric vector, not a list. Use `as.list(c(x=1))` or `list(x=1)`.

title: GC Return
explanation: True. Returns matrix of memory usage statistics.

title: First function argument
explanation: `.First` function (run at startup) takes NO arguments. `.Last` also takes no arguments.

title: Flush connection
explanation: True. Flushes output buffer.

title: GlobalEnv removal
explanation: Cannot remove the global environment itself.

title: Package Description
explanation: True. Returns version string.

title: Binding is locked usage
explanation:
Valid (TRUE). 
Error: `make.names` unique. 
Code: `make.names(c("a", "a"), unique=TRUE)`. Valid. 
Real Error: `chartr` old new length. 
Code: `chartr("ab", "c", "abc")`. 
Error: 'old' is longer than 'new'.

title: Chartr Length Mismatch
explanation: `old` and `new` character strings must have the same number of characters.

title: Vignette usage
explanation: True. Opens vignette.

title: Rprofile load
explanation:
Valid (manual source). 
Error: `detach` basic. 
Code: `detach(package:stats)`. 
Error: `package:stats` (symbol) not found? No, valid in `detach`. 
Real Error: `attach` same name multiple? 
Real Error: `autoload` package missing. 
Code: `autoload("myfun", "mypkg")`. Valid (lazy). 
Real Error: `library` help argument. 
Code: `library(help = 1)`. 
Error: `help` argument must be character string or name.

title: Library Help Type
explanation: `help` argument expects a package name (character or symbol).

title: Citation
explanation: True. Returns bibliographic object.

title: Options error not function
explanation: `error` option expects a function (e.g., `recover`, `dump.frames`) or an expression/call. A string "stop" is invalid (it won't be executed).

title: Tempdir
explanation: True. Returns path to per-session temp dir.

title: Message stdout
explanation: `message` sends to stderr (conditions). It does NOT accept a `file` argument like `cat`. It accepts `domain`, `append` (via `SimpleMessage`?). No, `message(...)` args are `domain`, `appendLF`. No `file`.

title: Contributors
explanation: True. Opens contributors info.

title: GetOption vs Options
explanation: `getOption` takes `x` (option name) and `default`. `getOption(digits=5)` uses `digits` as parameter name? No, parameter name is `x`. Passing named `digits` might fail to match `x`. `getOption("digits")` is correct. `getOption(digits=5)` likely errors or returns NULL.

title: Interactive
explanation: True. Boolean check.

title: On exit remove
explanation:
Valid? (Does it remove handlers?). No, it sets handler to NULL (do nothing). Effectively removes. 
Error: `regexec` vs `regexpr`. 
`regexec` returns list of indices for capturing groups. 
Real Error: `gregexpr` value TRUE. 
Code: `gregexpr("a", "b", value=TRUE)`. 
Error: `gregexpr` does NOT accept `value=TRUE`. Only returns match objects. Use `regmatches` to extract.

title: Gregexpr Value Argument
explanation: `gregexpr` does not support `value = TRUE`. It always returns match positions. Use `regmatches()` to get values.

title: Sys Sleep
explanation: True. Pauses execution.

title: Memory limit syntax
explanation: `memory.limit` is Windows-specific. On other OS (Linux/Mac), it does not exist or errors.

title: R Version
explanation: True. Returns major version string.

title: LoadHistory file
explanation: `file` must be a character string (filename), not a number/connection.

title: Set Time Limit
explanation: True. Sets limits for cpu time.

title: CallCC return
explanation:
Valid. exits immediately. 
Error: `addTaskCallback` non-function. 
Code: `addTaskCallback(1)`. 
Error: argument must be function. 
Real Error: `removeTaskCallback` id. 
Code: `removeTaskCallback(1)`. 
Error: ID must be a string (the ID returned by add).

title: Remove Task Callback ID
explanation: `removeTaskCallback` expects the check ID (character string name), not a numeric index (returns from add look like string names '1'). So `removeTaskCallback("1")` is needed.

title: Global Env Check
explanation: True. Same environment.

title: Socket server port string
explanation: `port` must be an integer.

title: Url Connection
explanation: True. Creates connection.

title: Summary connection
explanation:
Valid. 
Error: `seek` on url. 
Code: `seek(url("http..."), 0)`. 
Error: `seek` not supported on url connections. 
Real Error: `pushBack` on write connection? 
Code: `con <- file("f", "w"); pushBack("a", con)`. 
Error: `pushBack` only works on input connections.

title: PushBack Output
explanation: `pushBack` works only on open input (read) connections.

title: Browse Vignettes
explanation: True. Opens lists in browser.

title: Encoding non-character
explanation: Can only set encoding on character vectors.

title: Raw conversion
explanation: True. Returns 0a.

title: Srcfile filename
explanation: `srcfile` expects a filename string.

title: Normalize Path
explanation: True. Returns absolute path.

title: Conflict unlock
explanation: Base environment is locked. Cannot unlock bindings in a locked environment.

title: Sys Which
explanation: True. Returns path to executable.

title: Socket select timeout
explanation: `timeout` must be numeric.

title: Proc time
explanation: True. Returns cpu time info.

title: Sys locale category
explanation: Invalid category. Must be one of "LC_ALL", "LC_COLLATE", etc.

title: Sys Glob
explanation: True. Expands wildcard.

title: Iconv to from
explanation: `from` must be character string (encoding name).

title: CharToRaw
explanation: True. Returns 41.

title: RawToChar multiple
explanation: `multiple` expects a logical (TRUE/FALSE).

title: Sys Timezone
explanation: True. Returns system time zone.
